comment_data.body:
This could also use an f-string, just needs to double the `{` to get a literal.
```suggestion
            code.putln(f"PyObject ** const {Naming.pykwdlist_cname}[] = {{{non_pos_args_id}}};")
```

         non_posonly_args = [arg for arg in all_args if not arg.pos_only]

comment_data.body:
Yeah, I had considered it but found the triple braces too easy to miss on a quick read and the `{%s}` to be clearer. I already hit a few cases where I found it sad that f-strings don't make the code look clearer, as in this case.

Not sure. Do you vote for it or just propose it as an alternative?

comment_data.body:
Here is a different proposal:
```suggestion
        if non_posonly_args:
            non_posonly_args_init = '{%s}' % ','.join([
                f'&{code.intern_identifier(arg.entry.name)}'
                for arg in non_posonly_args
            ] + ['0'])
            code.putln(
                f"PyObject ** const {Naming.pykwdlist_cname}[] = {non_posonly_args_init};")
```

comment_data.body: GCC `-pedantic` warns about binary constants being C23 or GCC extension, so I decided to go old-fashion.

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.
* Support and use `am_send` for coroutines.
